entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

text: PC Lovelock has spent today with @EnvAgency in Downham/Kings Lynn area tackling illegal fishing various waterways and fisheries patrolled. 5 people dealt with for rod offences. @KingsLynnPolice #OPClampdown #OPTraverse #ruralpolicing #1765 https://t.co/Az6LynTqS5

@suesustainable @Jamesxparsons @NaturalEngland @EnvAgencySW @forfrome @WestcountryRT NFU rep for River Axe region told Wye Nutrient Management Board last week that it was 70% agricultural. 
50:50 seems to be a default. The Lugg moratorium was issued on 50:50 but we later found out new homes would be around 0.2%. EA have existing homes at 25% and already reducing.
RT @Nick_Unsworth: @plumeplotter Worryingly every #incinerator on theses plots #exceed their #emmission limits. Why is nothing done it will…
RT @Nick_Unsworth: @plumeplotter Worryingly every #incinerator on theses plots #exceed their #emmission limits. Why is nothing done it will…

@AgainstSewage @Jamesxparsons @EnvAgency Only 88k homes in whole of Herefordshire - we are 4th least populated county but one of largest in area. On average the whole county builds around 525 homes a year (past decade rates) and most are mains drainage with a few rural 🏠 on private treatment plants with stripper.

@AgainstSewage @Jamesxparsons @EnvAgency Not many, I only know Herefordshire stats/percentages sorry - existing septic tanks (not new homes which use high performance treatment plants) counted under the ‘Other’ data category which EA have at 9-10%. The other category includes industry, road run off and storm overflows.

@Jamesxparsons @NaturalEngland Depends where it is. Somerset River Frome above Frome it is all down to agriculture. And it's poor. And here's a tributary to the Brue a couple of weeks back, full of slurry. Flows to Levels. Reported to @EnvAgencySW , currently under investigation. @forfrome  @WestcountryRT https://t.co/uHqvQSwz3I

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

text: @Jamesxparsons @EnvAgency @MerryAlbright So how many private septic tanks are still discharging directly into watercourses?

But as @NFUCymru work with data provided by @NatResWales and the report sent to @HfdsCouncil is a compilation of estimates and a beleaguered monitoring programme by @EnvAgency ... there's an interesting 'regulatory gap' forming across both countries.
RT @WindrushWasp: Our Windrush neighbour the River Coln is dying and the @EnvAgency just lets it happen. Sound familiar? @Feargal_Sharkey @…

The @EnvAgency have no commercial nouse or moral compass .
They support officers who tell lies ie one in Tewkesbury office called Quine 
They negotiate those who can defend themselves via solicitors and pay hundreds of thousands to barristers ie £20000 pounds for three days work. https://t.co/1lEOOukJ3B
RT @WindrushWasp: Our Windrush neighbour the River Coln is dying and the @EnvAgency just lets it happen. Sound familiar? @Feargal_Sharkey @…

text: An assessment by @EnvAgency of the Wye, estimates the chief source of pollution (~60%+) is agricultural and waste water from existing homes (~25%). Sustainable house builder @MerryAlbright has estimated new homes on the Wye contribute less than 1% of phosphate loading.
